reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights in Nov 08 on a weekend trip to Rome.
reviews.title: Simple but you cant beat it for location & price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose the hotel because we needed a triple room and when I did an internet search, it came up and had a great price and was in a very central location - we couldnt believe our luck!
reviews.title: Falling Apart!

reviews.text: It was ideal for the train station for getting to and from airport or other areas of Italy. And it was very easy to find on Via Viminale, right next to the Opera house. We were able to walk to the Colliseum in about 20 mins along interesting streets and the Nazionale Street is very close by. The Spanish Steps were about 20 mins away too but so much to see on the route there.
reviews.title: First time in Rome

reviews.text: Checking in and out was easy and the best thing was that we could store our bags securely after checking out to explore the city further before leaving for the airport on our final day.
reviews.title: NOT THE BEST

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was on the third floor was clean but small for the 3 of us but we didnt mind as we were only sleeping there and were out all day. We had twin beds and a sofabed. Perfectly comfortable.
reviews.title: SMALL CLEAN ROOMS .GREAT LOCATION

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights in Sept 08. We chose the hotel because we were looking for something close to the central train station. It was a 5 - 7 minute walk to the station and easy to find. Check-in was easy and we had a room on the 4th (top floor). The room was an OK size with a mini-bar and small TV, it also had air con. The bathroom was small and your face was basically touching the towel rail when sitting on the toilet but the shower pressure was acceptable. The 2 single beds were passably comfortable and there were plenty of pillows and blankets. The included breakfast consisted of bread, bread rolls, croissants (cheese, butter and jams), plain yoghurt and cereal, along with tea, coffee and a very syrupy orange juice. You could also purchase Internet time on the provided pc in the lobby, or purchase a password so you could connect your own laptop using wifi (Although at 5 Euro for an hour it was quite expensive). In conclusion, if you're not planning on spending too much time in the hotel room and are only looking for somewhere to sleep and leave your bags then consider this place.
reviews.title: Average Hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: The hotel's location is perfect for a short stay in Rome as it's very close to the train station and all the main sights are reasonably close by. The room was cleaned daily and the buffet breakfast was enough to set us up for a long day's sightseeing. The room had excellent air conditioning if a bit noisy, but the earplugs which I never travel without took care of that!
reviews.title: Great value budget hotel

reviews.text: The only downside I would say was the size of the bathroom!
reviews.title: its like faulty towers !!!

reviews.text: the room was very small and dingy
reviews.title: Avoid the Impero at your peril

likes.disliked: — Service of the staff; quality of rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ,the shower cubicle was broken and held together with sellotape and the water went everywhere when you showered.
reviews.title: Old elegance

reviews.text: My stay at the Hotel Impero was an overall great experience. The hotel is located downtown near lots of restaurants and shopping. The staff was friendly and helpful and the breakfast was fantastic. The rooms are a nice size, including the bathroom and are very clean. Though the hotel doesn't have a very attractive outward appearance, it is very clean and has a decent interior. Public transportation is nearby in a suitable walking distance. The area appeared to be a safe area with plenty of lighting after dark.
reviews.title: Great Location!
Disappointing
reviews.text: We were very disappointed. First, we had a room on the first floor, but because the ventilator and the toilet seat were broken we got another room on the fourth floor.
This room was smaller. It was clean and daily maintained well. Or TV and airco did not work, but that was not a big problem because we were all day out.
reviews.title: Very comfy stay in Rome

reviews.text: The beds were excellent , but every night at around 3 o'clock were heard a loud noise of a shower !
reviews.title: Good Hotel in centre of Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was poor (cheese in plastic bags, boiled eggs) and we drunk the worst Italian coffee ever.
reviews.title: Good enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beautiful hotel Impero was a perfect place to stay while in Rome. Our room #104 was nicely appointed and clean. I peaked into room #120 and was ammazed by its size and amenities. There was a balcony and a fire place!!!! Request this room if possible! My only complaint was that the water in the shower did not go down well. We did not tell anyone as it was not a biggy for us. The locations is a 5 minute walk to Termini, 20 minute walk to Trevi fountain. Very convenient. ATM just down the street. Breakfast was not great compared to the other hotels we stayed in Europe, but OK for a day or two.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was apprehensive before our visit to Rome as I had read some reviews that weren't very good about this hotel.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

likes.liked: — The air conditioning - it was lovely and cool!!
likes.disliked: — Our room was next to the lift which meant our tv went fuzzy everytime the lift was used.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Luckily when I arrived I was pleased to find that it was a nice, clean hotel situated in a great area, close by to the metro and lots of main sights. The staff spoke English well and were extremely friendly and helpful. Our rooms were clean and maids came round every day to clean & change the towels. Our air conditioning was the best I have experienced, cooled us down in no time & the breakfast was great as it ran from 7 till 10 giving you 3 hours to grab something to eat. Pick ups could be arranged easily from this hotel for tours and the staff on reception phoned up to your room to let you know when the tour operators arrived so you didn't miss them. The only reason I haven't chosen 'excellent' as my rating was because the toilet was situated right next to the shower with little room so that you banged your knees on the shower cubicle. But that was the only flaw I would mention on what we found to be an exceptional hotel. We stayed for 7 days and it was great. (There is also a small supermarket one street away to the right for a cheap meal).
reviews.title: Great location
Lovely Hotel!
reviews.text: Great location as the hotel is only a few mins away from the main train station and bus stop. The terravision bus (airport bus link) stops only 5 mins away. The area where the hotel is very safe. The other side of the termini station didnt look and feel that safe.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel in general was clean and safe and the staff friendly. However, this is a budjet hotel and the breakfast was very limited.
reviews.title: When in Rome....

likes.liked: — great bed,view and close to station
